title: Tip Gurnee cops for charity
text: Daily Herald report Gurnee police will serve at a village restaurant Saturday in an effort to gain tips for a charity. The cops will be at Red Robin at Gurnee Mills from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. and 4 to 8 p.m. to benefit Special Olympics Illinois. In concert with Red Robin staff, the police will work as celebrity waiters, hosts and greeters. Diners can show their support by offering a "tip" at the end of their meal to benefit Special Olympics. The "Tip-A-Cop" fundraiser is one of several events Gurnee police participate in throughout the year to benefit Special Olympics Illinois and the Law Enforcement Torch Run. Share this page
